page.title: 10LIFESTYLES.
page.content: (1) CHANGES IN HOUSES. EIGHTY YEARS AGO HOUSES AROUND COOKSTOWN WERE ALL SIZES. SMALL HOUSES HAD ABOUT TWO OR THREE ROOMS. NOW, ON THE MONEYMORE ROAD AND COOLREAGHS ROAD THE HOUSES ARE VERY GRAND. THE RICHER PEOPLE LIVE IN THIS AREA OF THE TOWN. FORMERLY THERE WAS NOT ANY PIPED IN WATER SUPPLY IN HOUSES AND SOME PEOPLE HAD TO WALK A QUARTER OF A MILE TO THE NEAREST WELL. THE PEOPLE USED OUT-SIDE TOILETS, OFTEN OVER A STREAM AND THEY BATHED IN TIN-TUBS IN FRONT OF THE FIRE. THE HOUSES' ROOVES WERE OFTEN MADE OF THATCH WHICH WAS BARLEY OR WHEAT STRAW. POOR PEOPLE USED BENCHES TO SIT ON. NOWADAYS, THERE IS PIPED IN WATER AND PEOPLE HAVE BATHROOMS AND TOILETS IN THEIR HOUSES.
